StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genomic Studies of Oral Health and Disease: CIDR

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Funding support for the study “Genomic Studies of Oral Health and Disease” was provided by the National Institute of Dental and Craniofacial Research (NIDCR; grant number X01-HG009878). Genotyping services and assistance with data cleaning and imputation were funded by the NIDCR, and provided by the Center for Inherited Disease Research (CIDR) through a federal contract from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) to The Johns Hopkins University, contract number HHSN268201700006I. Data was collected and biological samples were obtained through the Center for Oral Health Research in Appalachia (COHRA), a joint initiative by the University of Pittsburgh, West Virginia University, and the University of Michigan. Biological sample preparation, data management, and data analysis was performed by the Center for Craniofacial and Dental Genetics at the University of Pittsburgh. These efforts were funded by the following NIDCR grants: 1 R01-DE014899, "Genetic Factors Contributing to Oral Health Disparities in Appalachia"; R01-DE014899-03S1, "Psychosocial Influences on Rural Children's Oral Health"; R01-DE014899-04S1, "Oral Microbiology Studies in Appalachia"; and 2 R01-DE014899, "Factors Contributing to Oral Health Disparities in Appalachia"). The Dental SCORE cohort was additionally supported, in part, by the National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA) grants P50-DA005605, “Drug Abuse Vulnerability: Mechanisms and Manifestations", and R01-DA019157, “Substance Use Disorder Liability: Candidate Gene System”, and by the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania Department of Health grant ME-02-384. This project relies heavily on Community Advisory Boards composed of local residents to guide investigation in a manner that is culturally appropriate and addresses perceived needs of the community.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Data use limitations vary by consent group and are as follows: 1) Dental and Oral Health, 2) Dental and Oral Health, Cardiac Health. Data use for a given consent group must be consistent with the described data use limitations. Methodological research is permitted for these consent groups.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Dental and Oral Health, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-DOH-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Dental and Oral Health. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Dental and Oral Health, Cardiac Health, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-DOHC-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Dental and Oral Health, Cardiac Health. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
